site_name: Development Land At Corner Of Chalk Pit Way And Sutton Common Road
decision_conditions: The development must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date hereof.Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended.

This permission shall be for a temporary period of six years from the first commencement of the use hereby permitted following which the use shall cease and the building be deconstructed and removed from the site. Within 6 months of the temporary period the development hereby approved shall be removed and the state of the land shall revert to the scheme approved under ref: DM2022/01764 or any such scheme amending that permission. Reason: To comply with policies 28 and 30 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018 and to ensure that the land is reverted back to it's approved state and the approved use after a temporary period.

Prior to the commencement of development, an Energy Statement incorporating 'as-designed' Simplified Building Energy Model (SBEM) outputs must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing which demonstrates the proposed building will apply the Mayor's energy hierarchy (be lean; be clean; be green) to achieve at least a 35% reduction in CO2 emissions compared to the Part L 2021 baseline and at least a 10% reduction in total emissions (regulated plus unregulated) through on-site renewable energy generation alone. The Energy Statement must provide further details of the proposed solar PV array and the Air Source Heat Pump (ASHP) unit(s).Reason: To comply with Policy 31 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018

Prior to first occupation, as-built' Simplified Building Energy Model (SBEM) outputs must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the approved energy strategy has been fully implemented on site. All of the approved measures must thereafter be retained for as long as the development is in existence.Reason: To comply with Policy 31 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The development must be carried out in accordance with the provisions of the Planning Fire Safety Strategy prepared by fds Consultants dated Jan 2025.Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates the necessary fire safety measures in accordance with the Mayor's London Plan Policy D12.

Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved, the off street parking spaces as shown on approved drawing T440-AXI04-SMS-00-DR-A-110-001 Rev P4 shall be implemented. The approved details shall be implemented in full prior to occupation of the development and retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure the development provides an adequate level of parking facilities in accordance with Policies 36 and 37 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved, the Section 278 works package which would enable the formation of a footway around the southwest corner of the application site must be implemented.Reason: To ensure safe access and egress for pedestrians at the site in accordance with Policy 36 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.
description: Erection of a temporary (up to 6 years) detached two storey building to house on site sales and marketing suites and show apartments with first floor balconies, solar panels to roof, external roof access ladder, lift and steps to/from the car park, new vehicular access to/from Sutton court Road, provision of car and cycle parking/spaces, pedestrian access to/from Chalk Pit Way, boundary treatments and access gates, external art installation and associated landscaping.

application_details.scheme_name: Chalk Gardens - Temporary Sales & Marketing Suite

PLAHIS Planning Application Reference: DM2024/01476--- Address: B And Q PlcSutton Court RoadSuttonSM1 4RQ--- Proposal: FORMAL DESCRIPTION: S73 Application to vary conditions 1 (Approved Drawings), 3 (Building Storey Heights), 4 (Number of Homes), 6 (Cycle Spaces), 7 (Car Parking) and 43 (Play Space Provision) of planning permission ref: DM2022/01764 for the 'Site clearance and the phased development of new buildings containing residential uses, Class E commercial uses and sui generis uses (inc. drinking establishments including those with expanded food provision), private and communal amenity space, car parking, cycle parking, and other associated works. (THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES AN ENVIRONMENTAL STATEMENT)' INFORMATIVE NOTES:The proposed changes comprise:o  1,014 homes (an additional 44 homes); of which 35% by habitable room (the number of affordable homes will increase from 337 to 353).o  Building heights ranging from 6 to 22 storeys. This is achieved through insertion of an additional single storey within six buildings (Blocks A1, A2, B, C2, D and F) and a reduction in the standard floor-to-floor height.o  Decreased heights to Buildings C1, E1, E2, G, H1 and H2.o  Reconfiguration of Building F Ground Floor and minor layout changeso  Minor layout changes to Building Ho  Increased play space (all ages).o  One additional blue badge parking spaceo  Increased residential cycle parking--- Status: PCO--- Decision: --- Date Decision Issued: ---
